S  i  g  n  i  f  i  c  a  n  c  e  o  f  t  h  e  s  t  u  d  y   57   58 The crystallins undergo extensive post-translational modifications in order to interact and 59 maintain the soluble basis for lenticular transparency. Severe perturbations of this balance of 60 modifications and interactions lead to inappropriate protein folding, association and 61 aggregation. Those protein aggregates, if a certain threshold is surpassed and perpetuated, 62 diffract incident light leading to lens opacification and cataractogenesis. In addition, the 63 crystallins in high concentration are more than physical structural components of the 64 crystalline lens, and their protein species have additional multiple catalytical or regulatory 65 functions affecting the transparency of the lens and thus, cataractogenesis. Therefore, it is 66 necessary to understand the dynamics of this protein superfamily. Proteomics research is an 67 ideal way to characterize the healthy lenticular protein constituents and elucidate the complex 68 factors involved in cataractogenesis, given that the lens consists mainly of proteins and water. 69

FIGREF0.text: 83The crystallins are water-soluble structural proteins of the lens fibers. Human crystallins are 84 classified into three main types: alpha, beta and gamma crystallins. Beta and gamma 85 crystallins are similar in sequence and structure, so they are grouped as a protein superfamilyneed an antioxidant environment in order to remain soluble and maintain the 89 transparency of the lens (6,9). In order to elucidate the complex factors involved in 90 cataractogenesis, it is necessary to understand the dynamics of this protein superfamily and 91 proteomics research is an ideal way to do so. 92With the progress in proteomic analysis, proteomic approaches have been applied to identify 93 proteins in various physiological or pathological conditions in the crystalline lens and analyze 94 the proteome of cataractous or normal lenses. Moreover, various investigations on different 95 aspects of the lens proteomics of different species have been carried out using a wide variety 96 of proteomic techniques (10). 97
